name: English Country Tune
description: English Country Tune is a luxuriant abstract 3D puzzle game containing more than a hundred levels situated throughout 17 worlds.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP                Processor: 1.5 GHz                Memory: 1 GB                Hard Disk Space: 300 MB                                Video Card: Direct X9.0c Compatible

reviews.review_text: The puzzles are so hard but that just makes it so satisfying to solve them. I love it.

A challenging 3D puzzler. Very first impression is 'Oh, this is just sokoban', and then it starts ramping up newer and newer concepts on you throughout the whole game,   A downside is that if you get stuck on a puzzle, you don't have many options to simply play around that puzzle - you HAVE to solve it in order to progress, even if that means looking up the solution. A case could be made that if you don't master the concept in an earlier puzzle, it will bite you in the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• in a later puzzle anyway, but I'm not sure that is always true.   If this sounds like your type of game, the amount of content makes it worth the full $5 pricetag. Otherwise, move on.
As a puzzle lover this game is insane. You will spend a lot of hours on the levels and sometimes you will get the feel to give up (but don't).

Awesome logic game. The difficulty is quite high, as one has to complete every level in an area to progress further and the puzzles can be really challenging... But after all this is what matters and the reason why this game so good ;)
OK i am warning you now this game will drive you absoulutely crazy, but if you're willing to brave insanity and puzzles that introduce mechanics with no rhyme or reason, you need this game.

This thing is like Puzzle Dimension took up drinking and went 'Oh, you aced all my puzzles, huh? WELL I GOT SOME ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•IN PUZZLES FOR YOU'. It's a game that takes off the kid gloves fast and has a MASS of stages. Just be warned: it is real 3D, you WILL have to rotate the camera, and ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• IS going to become hard in under 5 levels.  I ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing love it already.
Great game with mindblowing puzzles. Awesome
Very nice puzzle game. Very challenging.
üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü
This game is so difficult. If you're up for a really tough puzzle game where each level may take you an hour or more, then have fun playing this.
Absolutely brilliant puzzle game, adds a great twist to a classic formula, and plenty of levels of play. Not for the geometrically-challenged though.

I bought this game on a whim, I often enjoy the odd puzzle game and thought I'd give it a try. The first thing I noticed about this game were the rather quaint aesthetics and atmosphere. The game has a somewhat lax feel almost begging the player to continue. The varied puzzle types keep the game interesting and at times unforgiving. I'll be stuck on a level for a while, then out of nowhere an answer will appear making me feel like I've learnt, adapted and achieved something I had previously not been able to do or figure out. I got this on sale, for 39p, but this game is definitely worth the full price and is a must-have for puzzle fanatics or just the casual gamer... or everyone basically.
hard but very rewarding and beautiful

Either this game is too smart for me or this game is terrible. Given I‚Äôve seen walkthroughs that admit that they simply solved the puzzles through excessive trial and error, I‚Äôm inclined to believe the latter. But I‚Äôll be courteous because the developer added an undo feature that makes the game far more tolerable when the puzzles were simple enough, they were fun.

This is some pure, raw, intense puzzling. Just balls and squares and lines and your brain. And it can get brutal. One particularly merciless puzzle (very mild spoiler) requires you to build your OWN puzzle and solve it. You'll spend 30 minutes just figuring out how to design a puzzle that is solvable in the first place. Most puzzles will take you a few minutes, but you'll eventually be stumped, and you'll fiddle around with one for an hour. This game is perfect for masochists.

This is one of the most unique puzzle games I have ever played. Very big variety in concepts (a lot more than I expected, and I'm not even halfway through!) The difficulty is quite simple in some levels and 'worlds' (Garden, for instance), and INSANELY MIND-BOGGLINGLY DIFFICULT in others. This is a good game, but be warned: this is not something to play to unwind. This is something to play when you want to give your brain a good workout. With that in mind, I definitely recommend.
A very tough puzzle game that feels strangely akin to going about writing mathematical proofs. A clean, stylish aesthetic to boot.

TL;DR: This game is incredible!  These are different types of geometrical riddles. They're a challenge at times (which is what you want from a game like this) and change style A LOT! It also fully runs on Linux without any problems whatsoever. A small perk: the menu is very interestingly styled. For a cheap price highly recommended!   Subjective final score: 8/10  I shaved off points for in-game textures of the world and music, plus missing labels in the menu. They're all minor complaints in comparison to gameplay and such, but you don't want to give a game 10/10 when it's not absolutely perfect ;) ... I tend to be rather strict.  Big thumbs up.

A solid and very challenging puzzle game. You will need to think completely outside the box to complete most of these and it can take a while to understand the game's rules as the clues are usually vague.
If you enjoy puzzle games, try this one out! Usually I feel kind of cheated in puzzle games but this one is good
Well-designed, creative, and very challenging puzzles, presented in an engaging abstract visual and audio design.

Some obscure pretentious puzzling anyone? We play as a polyurethane mat flapping across chequered 3d structures and score balls into holes. It demands some getting used to the pequliar Unity engine physics and the restrictions of game rules you mostly figure out for yourself. Based on artificial logic it's levels provide some challenge to the mind (checkers math). If you enjoy abstract puzzles with gravitational rules which do not make any sense.

I tried playing it because it looked interesting. Visually, it's appealing, but otherwise, I the puzzle mechanic just doesn't work for me. Puzzles just aren't challenging at all. When I finally found a level I couldn't beat, there was no indication as to what I was supposed to do to beat it. A solid nope from me on this one. It's a puzzle game that does not feel at all rewarding.
Cute game. Not enough tutoral.
